nodes.bodyText: Javadocs should only have pre tag, not div.
xdocs should have source tag not, div or pre.
All examples should start at the first column and not start off this far indented. Look at the screenshot and how the example is so far to the right.
Please space out this line so it is easier to read. Everything is so compact. Line is allowed to span multiple if needed.

Please explain on a subsequent line where the counts come from. It helps to explain to users how counting happens so they grasp the check easier.
Example: X, Y, and Z are counted as 1 each which gives the total of 3. A, B, and C are ignored which don't add to the score.
I would even consider adding counting to non-violations to show it is below the threshold.

1 space after all comments, it makes them easier to read.

(&,|)

I would not use parenthesis or commas as it could be confused with the actual parenthesis in the code. You can use the technical name for the operators or stick with & and | but again, space them apart so they aren't so compact. The comment can span multiple lines if needed.

total complexity of 3(max allowed 3)

Again, space between words and (.
</source> tag looks to not be indented as far over as it was before create an unnecessary change. The other tags should align with this tag too.
The comment // violation should be on the same line as it would be reported in checkstyle. If more room is needed to explain reasoning, then that can be on the next line in its own comment.

// OK, 1(&) + 1(|) + 1(&) = 3
It is more compact and more descriptive.
Please apply to other examples.
Remember you can wrap expression on few lines to give more space for comments. Only comment ok/violation should be in the same line, explanation could be around if have no space for it, but ideally on the same line.
After update, do not forget to update image and CLI outputs.

I now see why the @since is a seen as a difference. This line's leading asterisk is off by 1. This line and all below it should be increased by 1. @since should not show as a difference in the commit dig.
